news.title: CheapBytes now selling Gentoo Linux CDs

body.p: CheapBytes is now selling Gentoo Linux/x86 1.1a i686 CDs for $5 USD apiece! :) Note that this CD will allow a build from scratch for *all* systems, but also has pre-built stuff for i686+ CPUs. We plan to add more CD offerings (sources, pre-built binaries, Gentoo/PPC and Sparc) in the near-future, so stay tuned. In the meantime, being able to order our latest CD for $5 ain't too shabby :)

Gentoo/Sparc status update: Thanks to Maarten Thibaut, Gentoo Linux/Sparc and Sparc64 development is moving along quite well and Gentoo Linux/Sparc and Sparc64 were recently mentioned on the UltraLinux site. For those interested, Gentoo Linux/Sparc installation tarballs can be gotten from ibiblio (as well as our mirrors.) Sparc64 tarballs, a Sparc ISO and (I hope!) documentation are being worked on and will be available in the near future. Thanks again to Maarten for getting Gentoo/Sparc and Sparc64 off the ground!

I'd also like to alert everyone to the many new documentation resources on the site. For your convenience, these resources are also listed on the left side of the main gentoo.org page. We have new documentation about USE variables, eclasses (creating OOP-like inherited ebuilds), how Java is set up under Gentoo Linux, enhancing Gentoo Linux security, Gentoo Linux/PPC installation, documentation on our rc-scripts as well as important updates to existing documentation. We also have a bunch of new IRC channels listed on the left side of our main page for your chatting pleasure. Enjoy!
